content:
Add a Time Input Element to a FlexCard

Available beginning Winter '22.

From the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer.
From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Time element onto the canvas.

Configure properties:

* In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
* In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.
* In Placeholder, enter temporary text that displays inside the input field.
* Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.
* Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.
* In Help Text, enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field.

Configure time-specific properties:

* Select a default input value from a merge field or enter a value as plain text in Default Value.
* Update the Time Format. Default is hh:mm a, which displays as 3:30 am or 3:30 pm.
* Set the Minimum Time and Maximum Time to limit the user to a specific time range.

Leave Maximum Time empty for the last interval of the day such as 11:30 pm. Leave Minimum Time empty for the first available interval, such as 12:00 am.

(Optional) Update the time intervals from the default 30 to another increment in Time Interval.

Configure additional properties:

* Click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section.
* Select an attribute and enter a value in the Value field.
* Execute an action when a user interacts with the input element by clicking + Add Action.
* Add conditions that must be met for the element to display.
* Style your element using the Style panel.
title: Adding Time Input Element in FlexCard Designer
